meanings.definition: A point or line where two or more things intersect or cross each other.
meanings.sent1: At the intersection of two roads, there is a traffic light.
meanings.sent2: I stopped at the intersection to let the pedestrians cross.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel found an intersection of branches to create a cozy nest.
meanings.sent4: Their ideas collided at the intersection of creativity and practicality.
meanings.sent5: The intersection of the river and the ocean created a beautiful estuary.

meanings.definition: The act or process of intersecting or crossing paths.
meanings.sent1: The intersection of the two laser beams created a fascinating pattern.
meanings.sent2: The intersection of our schedules made it difficult to find a suitable time to meet.
meanings.sent3: The intersection of our dance moves resulted in a hilarious mix-up.
meanings.sent4: Their interests had a surprising intersection at the book club meeting.
meanings.sent5: The intersection of our thoughts led to a breakthrough in our project.

meanings.definition: A place where roads or paths meet or cross.
meanings.sent1: The intersection of Main Street and Elm Street is always busy.
meanings.sent2: I took a left turn at the intersection to head towards the park.
meanings.sent3: The intersection of the hiking trails was marked by a big rock.
meanings.sent4: Their destinies had an unexpected intersection at the airport.
meanings.sent5: The intersection of the bike paths was a popular spot for cyclists.
